column16: There does not seem to be a way to associate images or other media to either Observations or diagnostic reports. Such supporting information is very useful in a number of observations, particularly clinical findings that may not include clinical imaging studies (such as a picture from a consumer camera. It should be able to add supporting information for the Observation. Perhaps Binary could be added to derivedFrom or Media?
column17: Lack of support for non-ImageStudy media

column16: There is a lack of support for data that is more than single dimensional. HL7 v2.8 supports both numerical array (NA) and multiplexed arrays. It is not clear how this is supported in FHIR. This sort of data is good for capturing information over time and other dimensions whose primary factors are in common. (There may be a way of doing this through multiple resource instances, but that could cause significant overhead in high frequency measurements.). It is possible that a numeric array may be addressed as described in 10.1.4.3.2 Observation.component, but that is not clear, not does it seem to address multiplexed arrays. This is important for situations where any one measurement is useless without context of the primary observation type.
column17: Lack of support for for multi-dimensional data
column21: Could find not related as not tied to a change from May 2016

column16: There does not seem to be a value that addresses appended results. V2.8 defines this as "Appended Report – Final results reviewed and further information provided for clarity without change to the original result values.". Suggest adding or providing guidance
column17: No Observation Status for appended results

column14: Unknown - The authoring system does not know which of the status values currently applies for this request. Note: This concept is not to be used for "other" - one of the listed statuses is presumed to apply, but the authoring system does not know which.
column16: It is possible that the authoring system did not indicate a status (as the observation was expressed through a means other than FHIR). There needs to be a way to address this scenario.
column17: unknown by source as opposed to author.
column21: Could find not related as not tied to a change from May 2016

column16: "artifact" is too abstract. If intent is for KM, specify.
column17: "artifact" is too abstract. If intent is for KM, specify.

column14:
If possible, use the most specific code you can

e.g.: Observation.code = 49134-0 Glucose [Mass/?volume] in Blood 2 hours post dose glucose

Alternatively, use code translations in Observation.code.

e.g.: Observation.code = coding-1: 20564-1 Oxygen saturation in Blood, coding-2: 59408-5 Oxygen saturation in Arterial blood by Pulse oximetry

Another alternative is to use the precondition extension.

e.g.:

Observation.code = 20564-1 Oxygen saturation in Blood, Observation.value: 98%

observation-precondition extension: Observation.code: 19995-0 Oxygen/Inspired gas Respiratory system by O2 Analyzer on ventilator Observation.value: 100%
column15:
1. Use a specific code, if one is available, but always provide a more general (e.g., methodless) code if available to support broader intelligibility. Include both in the coding list.
e.g., for Observation.code = 49134-0 Glucose [Mass/?volume] in Blood 2 hours post dose glucose
	make sure to include 2345-7 Glucose [Mass/​volume] in Serum or Plasma
2. Use a component for observations that cannot stand alone
	example: taken while patient was lying down (?)
3. Use a precondition for observations that can stand alone
	example: 19995-0 Oxygen/Inspired gas Respiratory system by O2 Analyzer on ventilator
column16:
a. recommend #2, not #1. #1 ("If possible, use the most specific code you can") is contrary to LOINC direction to decompose method.
b. use the same example for both points - glucose or O2.
c. GForge recommends component for dependent observation, extension for independent. This language did not make it into the spec, but it's a good question and should be addressed. (The examples in the Gforge don't actually distinguish, and should.)

column14: Alternatively, use code translations in Observation.code.
column15: Alternatively, use additional codes in Observation.code.

column14: The following list provides guidance on using codes or other observations to provide addition context that may alter how an observation is interpreted
column15: The following list provides guidance on using codes or other observations to provide additional context that may alter how an observation is interpreted
column16:
Refining the interpretation of an Observatoin using additional codes or Observations

Correct spelling of "additional"

ValueSet Extensibility Section :
 The guideline added is not clear. Is this intended to explain that addition/replacement  of a concept cannot be narrower or broader in meaning that the semantic intent for the data element for which it is being used, or that a concept cannot be added with intent to  replace the a concept code  already existing in the value set because it either more specific or more general in meaning? For those non-ontology/taxonomy experts, regarding the rules of concept definition within this context using some examples to illustrate might be more beneficial to better explain the intent of the guideline.
column17: Request simpler language for ValueSet Extensibility rules, ideally with illustrative examples.
column21: Submission included a reference to GF#17402, however the comment is not the same as that tracker item

column16:
Request addition of deprecated V3 codes MS (moderately susceptible) and VS (very susceptible) to the value set (from https://www.hl7.org/fhir/2018Sep/v3/ObservationInterpretation/cs.html).
Even though the codes are now deprecated, historical observations may still contain these codes, with no immediately clear mapping to display in their place.
column17: Request addition of deprecated V3 codes MS (moderately susceptible) and VS (very susceptible) to the value set.

column16:
The Observation resource should support inclusion of images/media (photos, graphics, charts, videos ect)
Common and important example use cases:
- wound observation
- child growth (inclusion of percentile chart depicting individual measures on the percentile curve)
- eye/retinal examination

This requirement is not supported in the core or extension resources
Add example showing how a component can be used to access slice with code.text (and without code:coding- ie NULL)
column21: Lloyd: Slicing based on code.text is ill-advised because code.text is expected to be what a human types and thus is not computationally reliable.  As such, including an example of this would be inappropriate.
column25: Not tied to a change from the May ballot

column16: Clarify what happens when there is no international standard that is used for a concept- how to pick from different options?  Or, should one make up HL7 code in that case until mature enough?  Or, should one use text field and not require coding?
column21: This is not an Observation-specific issue.  Suggest raising it with the vocabulary group.  Also, this is methodology, not something for inclusion in the FHIR spec.
